meanings.definition: A structure that can give rise to a new individual or colony
meanings.sent1: The propagule of the plant was a tiny seed waiting to grow.
meanings.sent2: The propagule floated in the wind, ready to start a new colony.
meanings.sent3: The propagule decided it was time to sprout and explore the world.
meanings.sent4: Like a magical seed, the propagule held the promise of new life.
meanings.sent5: The propagule was like a superhero, bringing forth new beginnings wherever it landed.

meanings.definition: A reproductive structure capable of developing into a new plant
meanings.sent1: The propagule contained all the information needed to become a plant.
meanings.sent2: Once the propagule took root, it began its journey to become a full-grown plant.
meanings.sent3: The propagule joked with the seeds about their future as plants.
meanings.sent4: In the soil, the propagule transformed into a green wonder.
meanings.sent5: Every propagule held the potential to bloom into a beautiful plant.

meanings.definition: A unit of asexual reproduction in plants
meanings.sent1: The propagule split off from the parent plant to start a new life.
meanings.sent2: Each propagule was a clone of the original plant, ensuring its survival.
meanings.sent3: The propagule challenged the seeds to a race for fun.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, the propagule multiplied silently, creating a new generation.
meanings.sent5: The propagule was like a secret agent, stealthily reproducing without fuss.
